content:
I'd be happy to help! However, I'm a large language model, I don't have access to real-time transit data or specific bus route information. I don't know the exact location of the park or the bus routes that stop near it.

But I can suggest a few options to help you get a list of bus routes that stop near the park:

1. **Transit Agency Website**: Visit the website of your city's public transportation agency (e.g., [www.yourcitytransit.com](http://www.yourcitytransit.com)) and use their trip planner tool or bus route finder to get a list of bus routes that stop near the park. You can enter the park's address or a nearby landmark to get the list of routes.
2. **Google Maps**: Open Google Maps on your computer or mobile device and enter the park's address or a nearby landmark. Click on the "Get Directions" button and select "Public Transportation" as the mode of transportation. Google Maps will show you a list of bus routes that stop near the park.
3. **Transit App**: Download a transit app like Moovit, Transit, or Citymapper that provides real-time transit information for your city. Enter the park's address or a nearby landmark, and the app will show you a list of bus routes that stop near the park.
4. **Bus Stop Sign**: If you're near the park, you can check the bus stop signs near the park to see the list of bus routes that stop there.

Remember to check the transit agency's website or a transit app for the most up-to-date information on bus routes and schedules.

If you provide me with more specific information about the park's location or the city you're in, I can try to give you more general guidance or point you in the right direction.
